trans-unit.source: How to choose machine learning algorithms | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to choose machine learning algorithms | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to choose Azure Machine Learning algorithms for supervised and unsupervised learning in clustering, classification, or regression experiments.
trans-unit.target: How to choose Azure Machine Learning algorithms for supervised and unsupervised learning in clustering, classification, or regression experiments.

trans-unit.source: How to choose algorithms for Microsoft Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: How to choose algorithms for Microsoft Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: The answer to the question "What machine learning algorithm should I use?"
trans-unit.target: The answer to the question "What machine learning algorithm should I use?"

trans-unit.source: is always "It depends."
trans-unit.target: is always "It depends."

trans-unit.source: It depends on the size, quality, and nature of the data.
trans-unit.target: It depends on the size, quality, and nature of the data.

trans-unit.source: It depends what you want to do with the answer.
trans-unit.target: It depends what you want to do with the answer.

trans-unit.source: It depends on how the math of the algorithm was translated into instructions for the computer you are using.
trans-unit.target: It depends on how the math of the algorithm was translated into instructions for the computer you are using.

trans-unit.source: And it depends on how much time you have.
trans-unit.target: And it depends on how much time you have.

trans-unit.source: Even the most experienced data scientists can't tell which algorithm will perform best before trying them.
trans-unit.target: Even the most experienced data scientists can't tell which algorithm will perform best before trying them.

trans-unit.source: The Machine Learning Algorithm Cheat Sheet
trans-unit.target: The Machine Learning Algorithm Cheat Sheet

trans-unit.source: The **Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Algorithm Cheat Sheet** helps you choose the right machine learning algorithm for your predictive analytics solutions from the Microsoft Azure Machine Learning library of algorithms.
trans-unit.target: The **Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Algorithm Cheat Sheet** helps you choose the right machine learning algorithm for your predictive analytics solutions from the Microsoft Azure Machine Learning library of algorithms.

trans-unit.source: This article walks you through how to use it.
trans-unit.target: This article walks you through how to use it.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To download the cheat sheet and follow along with this article, go to [Machine learning algorithm cheat sheet for Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-algorithm-cheat-sheet.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To download the cheat sheet and follow along with this article, go to [Machine learning algorithm cheat sheet for Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-algorithm-cheat-sheet.md).

trans-unit.source: This cheat sheet has a very specific audience in mind: a beginning data scientist with undergraduate-level machine learning, trying to choose an algorithm to start with in Azure Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: This cheat sheet has a very specific audience in mind: a beginning data scientist with undergraduate-level machine learning, trying to choose an algorithm to start with in Azure Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: That means that it makes some generalizations and oversimplifications, but it will point you in a safe direction.
trans-unit.target: That means that it makes some generalizations and oversimplifications, but it will point you in a safe direction.

trans-unit.source: It also means that there are lots of algorithms not listed here.
trans-unit.target: It also means that there are lots of algorithms not listed here.

trans-unit.source: As Azure Machine Learning grows to encompass a more complete set of available methods, we'll add them.
trans-unit.target: As Azure Machine Learning grows to encompass a more complete set of available methods, we'll add them.

trans-unit.source: These recommendations are compiled feedback and tips from a lot of data scientists and machine learning experts.
trans-unit.target: These recommendations are compiled feedback and tips from a lot of data scientists and machine learning experts.

trans-unit.source: We didn't agree on everything, but I've tried to harmonize our opinions into a rough consensus.
trans-unit.target: We didn't agree on everything, but I've tried to harmonize our opinions into a rough consensus.

trans-unit.source: Most of the statements of disagreement begin with "It depends…"
trans-unit.target: Most of the statements of disagreement begin with "It depends…"

trans-unit.source: How to use the cheat sheet
trans-unit.target: How to use the cheat sheet

trans-unit.source: Read the path and algorithm labels on the chart as "For *<path label>* use *<algorithm>*."
trans-unit.target: Read the path and algorithm labels on the chart as "For *<path label>* use *<algorithm>*."

trans-unit.source: For example, "For *speed* use *two class logistic regression*."
trans-unit.target: For example, "For *speed* use *two class logistic regression*."

trans-unit.source: Sometimes more than one branch will apply.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes more than one branch will apply.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes none of them will be a perfect fit.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes none of them will be a perfect fit.

trans-unit.source: They're intended to be rule-of-thumb recommendations, so don't worry about it being exact.
trans-unit.target: They're intended to be rule-of-thumb recommendations, so don't worry about it being exact.

trans-unit.source: Several data scientists I talked with said that the only sure way to find the very best algorithm is to try all of them.
trans-unit.target: Several data scientists I talked with said that the only sure way to find the very best algorithm is to try all of them.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example from the [Cortana Analytics Gallery](http://gallery.azureml.net/) of an experiment that tries several algorithms against the same data and compares the results: [Compare Multi-class Classifiers: Letter recognition](http://gallery.azureml.net/Details/a635502fc98b402a890efe21cec65b92).
trans-unit.target: Here's an example from the [Cortana Analytics Gallery](http://gallery.azureml.net/) of an experiment that tries several algorithms against the same data and compares the results: [Compare Multi-class Classifiers: Letter recognition](http://gallery.azureml.net/Details/a635502fc98b402a890efe21cec65b92).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] To download and print a diagram that gives an overview of the capabilities of Machine Learning Studio, see [Overview diagram of Azure Machine Learning Studio capabilities](machine-learning-studio-overview-diagram.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] To download and print a diagram that gives an overview of the capabilities of Machine Learning Studio, see [Overview diagram of Azure Machine Learning Studio capabilities](machine-learning-studio-overview-diagram.md).

trans-unit.source: Flavors of machine learning
trans-unit.target: Flavors of machine learning

trans-unit.source: Supervised
trans-unit.target: Supervised

trans-unit.source: Supervised learning algorithms make predictions based on a set of
trans-unit.target: Supervised learning algorithms make predictions based on a set of

trans-unit.source: examples.
trans-unit.target: examples.

trans-unit.source: For instance, historical stock prices can be used to hazard
trans-unit.target: For instance, historical stock prices can be used to hazard

trans-unit.source: guesses at future prices.
trans-unit.target: guesses at future prices.

trans-unit.source: Each example used for training is labeled with
trans-unit.target: Each example used for training is labeled with

trans-unit.source: the value of interest—in this case the stock price.
trans-unit.target: the value of interest—in this case the stock price.

trans-unit.source: A supervised
trans-unit.target: A supervised

trans-unit.source: learning algorithm looks for patterns in those value labels.
trans-unit.target: learning algorithm looks for patterns in those value labels.

trans-unit.source: It can use
trans-unit.target: It can use

trans-unit.source: any information that might be relevant—the day of the week, the season,
trans-unit.target: any information that might be relevant—the day of the week, the season,

trans-unit.source: the company's financial data, the type of industry, the presence of
trans-unit.target: the company's financial data, the type of industry, the presence of

trans-unit.source: disruptive geopolicitical events—and each algorithm looks for different
trans-unit.target: disruptive geopolicitical events—and each algorithm looks for different

trans-unit.source: types of patterns.
trans-unit.target: types of patterns.

trans-unit.source: After the algorithm has found the best pattern it
trans-unit.target: After the algorithm has found the best pattern it

trans-unit.source: can, it uses that pattern to make predictions for unlabeled testing
trans-unit.target: can, it uses that pattern to make predictions for unlabeled testing

trans-unit.source: data—tomorrow's prices.
trans-unit.target: data—tomorrow's prices.

trans-unit.source: This is a popular and useful type of machine learning.
trans-unit.target: This is a popular and useful type of machine learning.

trans-unit.source: With one
trans-unit.target: With one

trans-unit.source: exception, all of the modules in Azure Machine Learning are supervised learning
trans-unit.target: exception, all of the modules in Azure Machine Learning are supervised learning

trans-unit.source: algorithms.
trans-unit.target: algorithms.

trans-unit.source: There are several specific types of supervised learning that
trans-unit.target: There are several specific types of supervised learning that

trans-unit.source: are represented within Azure Machine Learning: classification, regression, and anomaly
trans-unit.target: are represented within Azure Machine Learning: classification, regression, and anomaly

trans-unit.source: detection.
trans-unit.target: detection.

trans-unit.source: **Classification**.
trans-unit.target: **Classification**.

trans-unit.source: When the data are being used to predict a category, supervised learning is also called classification.
trans-unit.target: When the data are being used to predict a category, supervised learning is also called classification.

trans-unit.source: This is the case when assigning an image as a picture of either a 'cat' or a 'dog'.
trans-unit.target: This is the case when assigning an image as a picture of either a 'cat' or a 'dog'.

trans-unit.source: When there are only two choices, this is called **two-class** or **binomial classification**.
trans-unit.target: When there are only two choices, this is called **two-class** or **binomial classification**.

trans-unit.source: When there are more categories, as when predicting the winner of the NCAA March Madness tournament, this problem is known as **multi-class classification**.
trans-unit.target: When there are more categories, as when predicting the winner of the NCAA March Madness tournament, this problem is known as **multi-class classification**.

trans-unit.source: **Regression**.
trans-unit.target: **Regression**.

trans-unit.source: When a value is being predicted, as with stock prices, supervised learning is called regression.
trans-unit.target: When a value is being predicted, as with stock prices, supervised learning is called regression.

trans-unit.source: **Anomaly detection**.
trans-unit.target: **Anomaly detection**.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes the goal is to identify data points that are simply unusual.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes the goal is to identify data points that are simply unusual.

trans-unit.source: In fraud detection, for example, any highly unusual credit card spending patterns are suspect.
trans-unit.target: In fraud detection, for example, any highly unusual credit card spending patterns are suspect.

trans-unit.source: The possible variations are so numerous and the training examples so few, that it's not feasible to learn what fraudulent activity looks like.
trans-unit.target: The possible variations are so numerous and the training examples so few, that it's not feasible to learn what fraudulent activity looks like.

trans-unit.source: The approach that anomaly detection takes is to simply learn what normal activity looks like (using a history non-fraudulent transactions) and identify anything that is significantly different.
trans-unit.target: The approach that anomaly detection takes is to simply learn what normal activity looks like (using a history non-fraudulent transactions) and identify anything that is significantly different.

trans-unit.source: Unsupervised
trans-unit.target: Unsupervised

trans-unit.source: In unsupervised learning, data points have no labels associated with
trans-unit.target: In unsupervised learning, data points have no labels associated with

trans-unit.source: them.
trans-unit.target: them.

trans-unit.source: Instead, the goal of an unsupervised learning algorithm is to
trans-unit.target: Instead, the goal of an unsupervised learning algorithm is to

trans-unit.source: organize the data in some way or to describe its structure.
trans-unit.target: organize the data in some way or to describe its structure.

trans-unit.source: This can
trans-unit.target: This can

trans-unit.source: mean grouping it into clusters or finding different ways of looking at
trans-unit.target: mean grouping it into clusters or finding different ways of looking at

trans-unit.source: complex data so that it appears simpler or more organized.
trans-unit.target: complex data so that it appears simpler or more organized.

trans-unit.source: Reinforcement learning
trans-unit.target: Reinforcement learning

trans-unit.source: In reinforcement learning, the algorithm gets to choose an action in
trans-unit.target: In reinforcement learning, the algorithm gets to choose an action in

trans-unit.source: response to each data point.
trans-unit.target: response to each data point.

trans-unit.source: The learning algorithm also receives a
trans-unit.target: The learning algorithm also receives a

trans-unit.source: reward signal a short time later, indicating how good the decision was.
trans-unit.target: reward signal a short time later, indicating how good the decision was.

trans-unit.source: Based on this, the algorithm modifies its strategy in order to achieve
trans-unit.target: Based on this, the algorithm modifies its strategy in order to achieve

trans-unit.source: the highest reward.
trans-unit.target: the highest reward.

trans-unit.source: Currently there are no reinforcement learning
trans-unit.target: Currently there are no reinforcement learning

trans-unit.source: algorithm modules in Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: algorithm modules in Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: Reinforcement learning is common in
trans-unit.target: Reinforcement learning is common in

trans-unit.source: robotics, where the set of sensor readings at one point in time is a
trans-unit.target: robotics, where the set of sensor readings at one point in time is a

trans-unit.source: data point, and the algorithm must choose the robot's next action.
trans-unit.target: data point, and the algorithm must choose the robot's next action.

trans-unit.source: It is
trans-unit.target: It is

trans-unit.source: also a natural fit for Internet of Things applications.
trans-unit.target: also a natural fit for Internet of Things applications.

trans-unit.source: Considerations when choosing an algorithm
trans-unit.target: Considerations when choosing an algorithm

trans-unit.source: Accuracy
trans-unit.target: Accuracy

trans-unit.source: Getting the most accurate answer possible isn't always necessary.
trans-unit.target: Getting the most accurate answer possible isn't always necessary.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes an approximation is adequate, depending on what you want to use it for.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes an approximation is adequate, depending on what you want to use it for.

trans-unit.source: If that's the case, you may be able to cut your processing time dramatically by sticking with more approximate methods.
trans-unit.target: If that's the case, you may be able to cut your processing time dramatically by sticking with more approximate methods.

trans-unit.source: Another advantage of more approximate methods is that they naturally tend to avoid [overfitting](https://youtu.be/DQWI1kvmwRg).
trans-unit.target: Another advantage of more approximate methods is that they naturally tend to avoid [overfitting](https://youtu.be/DQWI1kvmwRg).

trans-unit.source: Training time
trans-unit.target: Training time

trans-unit.source: The number of minutes or hours necessary to train a model varies a great
trans-unit.target: The number of minutes or hours necessary to train a model varies a great

trans-unit.source: deal between algorithms.
trans-unit.target: deal between algorithms.

trans-unit.source: Training time is often closely tied to
trans-unit.target: Training time is often closely tied to

trans-unit.source: accuracy—one typically accompanies the other.
trans-unit.target: accuracy—one typically accompanies the other.

trans-unit.source: In addition, some
trans-unit.target: In addition, some

trans-unit.source: algorithms are more sensitive to the number of data points than others.
trans-unit.target: algorithms are more sensitive to the number of data points than others.

trans-unit.source: When time is limited it can drive the choice of algorithm, especially
trans-unit.target: When time is limited it can drive the choice of algorithm, especially

trans-unit.source: when the data set is large.
trans-unit.target: when the data set is large.

trans-unit.source: Linearity
trans-unit.target: Linearity

trans-unit.source: Lots of machine learning algorithms make use of linearity.
trans-unit.target: Lots of machine learning algorithms make use of linearity.

trans-unit.source: Linear
trans-unit.target: Linear

trans-unit.source: classification algorithms assume that classes can be separated by a
trans-unit.target: classification algorithms assume that classes can be separated by a

trans-unit.source: straight line (or its higher-dimensional analog).
trans-unit.target: straight line (or its higher-dimensional analog).

trans-unit.source: These include logistic
trans-unit.target: These include logistic

trans-unit.source: regression and support vector machines (as implemented in Azure Machine Learning).
trans-unit.target: regression and support vector machines (as implemented in Azure Machine Learning).

trans-unit.source: Linear regression algorithms assume that data trends follow a straight
trans-unit.target: Linear regression algorithms assume that data trends follow a straight

trans-unit.source: line.
trans-unit.target: line.

trans-unit.source: These assumptions aren't bad for some problems, but on others they
trans-unit.target: These assumptions aren't bad for some problems, but on others they

trans-unit.source: bring accuracy down.
trans-unit.target: bring accuracy down.

trans-unit.source: ![Non-linear class bounday][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Non-linear class bounday][1]

trans-unit.source: ***Non-linear class boundary*** *- relying on a linear classification algorithm would result in low accuracy*
trans-unit.target: ***Non-linear class boundary*** *- relying on a linear classification algorithm would result in low accuracy*

trans-unit.source: ![Data with a nonlinear trend][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Data with a nonlinear trend][2]

trans-unit.source: ***Data with a nonlinear trend*** *- using a linear regression method would generate much larger errors than necessary*
trans-unit.target: ***Data with a nonlinear trend*** *- using a linear regression method would generate much larger errors than necessary*

trans-unit.source: Despite their dangers, linear algorithms are very popular as a first
trans-unit.target: Despite their dangers, linear algorithms are very popular as a first

trans-unit.source: line of attack.
trans-unit.target: line of attack.

trans-unit.source: They tend to be algorithmically simple and fast to
trans-unit.target: They tend to be algorithmically simple and fast to

trans-unit.source: train.
trans-unit.target: train.

trans-unit.source: Number of parameters
trans-unit.target: Number of parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameters are the knobs a data scientist gets to turn when setting up
trans-unit.target: Parameters are the knobs a data scientist gets to turn when setting up

trans-unit.source: an algorithm.
trans-unit.target: an algorithm.

trans-unit.source: They are numbers that affect the algorithm's behavior,
trans-unit.target: They are numbers that affect the algorithm's behavior,

trans-unit.source: such as error tolerance or number of iterations, or options between
trans-unit.target: such as error tolerance or number of iterations, or options between

trans-unit.source: variants of how the algorithm behaves.
trans-unit.target: variants of how the algorithm behaves.

trans-unit.source: The training time and accuracy of
trans-unit.target: The training time and accuracy of

trans-unit.source: the algorithm can sometimes be quite sensitive to getting just the right
trans-unit.target: the algorithm can sometimes be quite sensitive to getting just the right

trans-unit.source: settings.
trans-unit.target: settings.

trans-unit.source: Typically, algorithms with large numbers parameters require
trans-unit.target: Typically, algorithms with large numbers parameters require

trans-unit.source: the most trial and error to find a good combination.
trans-unit.target: the most trial and error to find a good combination.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, there is a [parameter sweeping](machine-learning-algorithm-parameters-optimize.md) module block in Azure Machine Learning that automatically tries all parameter combinations at whatever granularity you choose.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, there is a [parameter sweeping](machine-learning-algorithm-parameters-optimize.md) module block in Azure Machine Learning that automatically tries all parameter combinations at whatever granularity you choose.

trans-unit.source: While this is a great way to make sure you've spanned the parameter space, the time required to train a model increases exponentially with the number of parameters.
trans-unit.target: While this is a great way to make sure you've spanned the parameter space, the time required to train a model increases exponentially with the number of parameters.

trans-unit.source: The upside is that having many parameters typically indicates that an
trans-unit.target: The upside is that having many parameters typically indicates that an

trans-unit.source: algorithm has greater flexibility.
trans-unit.target: algorithm has greater flexibility.

trans-unit.source: It can often achieve very good
trans-unit.target: It can often achieve very good

trans-unit.source: accuracy.
trans-unit.target: accuracy.

trans-unit.source: Provided you can find the right combination of parameter
trans-unit.target: Provided you can find the right combination of parameter

trans-unit.source: settings.
trans-unit.target: settings.

trans-unit.source: Number of features
trans-unit.target: Number of features

trans-unit.source: For certain types of data, the number of features can be very large
trans-unit.target: For certain types of data, the number of features can be very large

trans-unit.source: compared to the number of data points.
trans-unit.target: compared to the number of data points.

trans-unit.source: This is often the case with
trans-unit.target: This is often the case with

trans-unit.source: genetics or textual data.
trans-unit.target: genetics or textual data.

trans-unit.source: The large number of features can bog down some
trans-unit.target: The large number of features can bog down some

trans-unit.source: learning algorithms, making training time unfeasibly long.
trans-unit.target: learning algorithms, making training time unfeasibly long.

trans-unit.source: Support
trans-unit.target: Support

trans-unit.source: Vector Machines are particularly well suited to this case (see below).
trans-unit.target: Vector Machines are particularly well suited to this case (see below).

trans-unit.source: Special cases
trans-unit.target: Special cases

trans-unit.source: Some learning algorithms make particular assumptions about the structure
trans-unit.target: Some learning algorithms make particular assumptions about the structure

trans-unit.source: of the data or the desired results.
trans-unit.target: of the data or the desired results.

trans-unit.source: If you can find one that fits your
trans-unit.target: If you can find one that fits your

trans-unit.source: needs, it can give you more useful results, more accurate predictions,
trans-unit.target: needs, it can give you more useful results, more accurate predictions,

trans-unit.source: or faster training times.
trans-unit.target: or faster training times.

trans-unit.source: **Algorithm properties:**
trans-unit.target: **Algorithm properties:**

trans-unit.source: **●** - shows excellent accuracy, fast training times, and the use of linearity

trans-unit.source: Algorithm notes
trans-unit.target: Algorithm notes

trans-unit.source: Linear regression
trans-unit.target: Linear regression

trans-unit.source: As mentioned previously, [linear regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905978.aspx) fits a line (or plane, or hyperplane) to the data set.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned previously, [linear regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905978.aspx) fits a line (or plane, or hyperplane) to the data set.

trans-unit.source: It's a workhorse, simple and fast, but it may be overly simplistic for some problems. Check here for a [linear regression tutorial](machine-learning-linear-regression-in-azure.md).
trans-unit.target: It's a workhorse, simple and fast, but it may be overly simplistic for some problems. Check here for a [linear regression tutorial](machine-learning-linear-regression-in-azure.md).

trans-unit.source: ![Data with a linear trend][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Data with a linear trend][3]

trans-unit.source: ***Data with a linear trend***
trans-unit.target: ***Data with a linear trend***

trans-unit.source: Logistic regression
trans-unit.target: Logistic regression

trans-unit.source: Although it confusingly includes 'regression' in the name, logistic regression is actually a powerful tool for [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905994.aspx) and [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905853.aspx) classification.
trans-unit.target: Although it confusingly includes 'regression' in the name, logistic regression is actually a powerful tool for [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905994.aspx) and [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905853.aspx) classification.

trans-unit.source: It's fast and simple.
trans-unit.target: It's fast and simple.

trans-unit.source: The fact that it uses an 'S'-shaped curve instead of a straight line makes it a natural fit for dividing data into groups.
trans-unit.target: The fact that it uses an 'S'-shaped curve instead of a straight line makes it a natural fit for dividing data into groups.

trans-unit.source: Logistic regression gives linear class boundaries, so when you use it, make sure a linear approximation is something you can live with.
trans-unit.target: Logistic regression gives linear class boundaries, so when you use it, make sure a linear approximation is something you can live with.

trans-unit.source: ![Logistic regression to two-class data with just one feature][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Logistic regression to two-class data with just one feature][4]

trans-unit.source: ***A logistic regression to two-class data with just one feature*** *- the class boundary is the point at which the logistic curve is just as close to both classes*
trans-unit.target: ***A logistic regression to two-class data with just one feature*** *- the class boundary is the point at which the logistic curve is just as close to both classes*

trans-unit.source: Trees, forests, and jungles
trans-unit.target: Trees, forests, and jungles

trans-unit.source: Decision forests ([regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905862.aspx), [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906008.aspx), and [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906015.aspx)), decision jungles ([two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905976.aspx) and [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905963.aspx)), and boosted decision trees ([regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905801.aspx) and [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906025.aspx)) are all based on decision trees, a foundational machine learning concept.
trans-unit.target: Decision forests ([regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905862.aspx), [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906008.aspx), and [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906015.aspx)), decision jungles ([two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905976.aspx) and [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905963.aspx)), and boosted decision trees ([regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905801.aspx) and [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906025.aspx)) are all based on decision trees, a foundational machine learning concept.

trans-unit.source: There are many variants of decision trees, but they all do the same thing—subdivide the feature space into regions with mostly the same label.
trans-unit.target: There are many variants of decision trees, but they all do the same thing—subdivide the feature space into regions with mostly the same label.

trans-unit.source: These can be regions of consistent category or of constant value, depending on whether you are doing classification or regression.
trans-unit.target: These can be regions of consistent category or of constant value, depending on whether you are doing classification or regression.

trans-unit.source: ![Decision tree subdivides a feature space][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Decision tree subdivides a feature space][5]

trans-unit.source: ***A decision tree subdivides a feature space into regions of roughly uniform values***
trans-unit.target: ***A decision tree subdivides a feature space into regions of roughly uniform values***

trans-unit.source: Because a feature space can be subdivided into arbitrarily small
trans-unit.target: Because a feature space can be subdivided into arbitrarily small

trans-unit.source: regions, it's easy to imagine dividing it finely enough to have one data
trans-unit.target: regions, it's easy to imagine dividing it finely enough to have one data

trans-unit.source: point per region—an extreme example of overfitting.
trans-unit.target: point per region—an extreme example of overfitting.

trans-unit.source: In order to avoid
trans-unit.target: In order to avoid

trans-unit.source: this, a large set of trees are constructed with special mathematical
trans-unit.target: this, a large set of trees are constructed with special mathematical

trans-unit.source: care taken that the trees are not correlated.
trans-unit.target: care taken that the trees are not correlated.

trans-unit.source: The average of this
trans-unit.target: The average of this

trans-unit.source: "decision forest" is a tree that avoids overfitting.
trans-unit.target: "decision forest" is a tree that avoids overfitting.

trans-unit.source: Decision forests
trans-unit.target: Decision forests

trans-unit.source: can use a lot of memory.
trans-unit.target: can use a lot of memory.

trans-unit.source: Decision jungles are a variant that consumes
trans-unit.target: Decision jungles are a variant that consumes

trans-unit.source: less memory at the expense of a slightly longer training time.
trans-unit.target: less memory at the expense of a slightly longer training time.

trans-unit.source: Boosted decision trees avoid overfitting by limiting how many times they can subdivide and how few data points are allowed in each region.
trans-unit.target: Boosted decision trees avoid overfitting by limiting how many times they can subdivide and how few data points are allowed in each region.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm constructs a sequence of trees, each of which learns to compensate for the error left by the tree before.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm constructs a sequence of trees, each of which learns to compensate for the error left by the tree before.

trans-unit.source: The result is a very accurate learner that tends to use a lot of memory.
trans-unit.target: The result is a very accurate learner that tends to use a lot of memory.

trans-unit.source: For the full technical description, check out [Friedman's original paper](http://www-stat.stanford.edu/~jhf/ftp/trebst.pdf).
trans-unit.target: For the full technical description, check out [Friedman's original paper](http://www-stat.stanford.edu/~jhf/ftp/trebst.pdf).

trans-unit.source: [Fast forest quantile regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913093.aspx) is a variation of decision trees for the special case where you want to know not only the typical (median) value of the data within a region, but also its distribution in the form of quantiles.
trans-unit.target: [Fast forest quantile regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913093.aspx) is a variation of decision trees for the special case where you want to know not only the typical (median) value of the data within a region, but also its distribution in the form of quantiles.

trans-unit.source: Neural networks and perceptrons
trans-unit.target: Neural networks and perceptrons

trans-unit.source: Neural networks are brain-inspired learning algorithms covering [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906030.aspx), [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905947.aspx), and [regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905924.aspx) problems.
trans-unit.target: Neural networks are brain-inspired learning algorithms covering [multiclass](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906030.aspx), [two-class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905947.aspx), and [regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905924.aspx) problems.

trans-unit.source: They come in an infinite variety, but the neural networks within Azure Machine Learning are all of the form of directed acyclic graphs.
trans-unit.target: They come in an infinite variety, but the neural networks within Azure Machine Learning are all of the form of directed acyclic graphs.

trans-unit.source: That means that input features are passed forward (never backward) through a sequence of layers before being turned into outputs.
trans-unit.target: That means that input features are passed forward (never backward) through a sequence of layers before being turned into outputs.

trans-unit.source: In each layer, inputs are weighted in various combinations, summed, and passed on to the next layer.
trans-unit.target: In each layer, inputs are weighted in various combinations, summed, and passed on to the next layer.

trans-unit.source: This combination of simple calculations results in the ability to learn sophisticated class boundaries and data trends, seemingly by magic.
trans-unit.target: This combination of simple calculations results in the ability to learn sophisticated class boundaries and data trends, seemingly by magic.

trans-unit.source: Many-layered networks of this sort perform the "deep learning" that fuels so much tech reporting and science fiction.
trans-unit.target: Many-layered networks of this sort perform the "deep learning" that fuels so much tech reporting and science fiction.

trans-unit.source: This high performance doesn't come for free, though.
trans-unit.target: This high performance doesn't come for free, though.

trans-unit.source: Neural networks can take a long time to train, particularly for large data sets with lots of features.
trans-unit.target: Neural networks can take a long time to train, particularly for large data sets with lots of features.

trans-unit.source: They also have more parameters than most algorithms, which means that parameter sweeping expands the training time a great deal.
trans-unit.target: They also have more parameters than most algorithms, which means that parameter sweeping expands the training time a great deal.

trans-unit.source: And for those overachievers who wish to [specify their own network structure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=402867), the possibilities are inexhaustible.
trans-unit.target: And for those overachievers who wish to [specify their own network structure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=402867), the possibilities are inexhaustible.

trans-unit.source: ![Boundaries learned by neural networks][6]
trans-unit.target: ![Boundaries learned by neural networks][6]

trans-unit.source: ***The boundaries learned by neural networks can be complex and irregular***
trans-unit.target: ***The boundaries learned by neural networks can be complex and irregular***

trans-unit.source: The [two-class averaged perceptron](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906036.aspx) is neural networks' answer to skyrocketing training times.
trans-unit.target: The [two-class averaged perceptron](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906036.aspx) is neural networks' answer to skyrocketing training times.

trans-unit.source: It uses a network structure that gives linear class boundaries.
trans-unit.target: It uses a network structure that gives linear class boundaries.

trans-unit.source: It is almost primitive by today's standards, but it has a long history of working robustly and is small enough to learn quickly.
trans-unit.target: It is almost primitive by today's standards, but it has a long history of working robustly and is small enough to learn quickly.

trans-unit.source: SVMs
trans-unit.target: SVMs

trans-unit.source: Support vector machines (SVMs) find the boundary that separates classes by as wide a margin as possible.
trans-unit.target: Support vector machines (SVMs) find the boundary that separates classes by as wide a margin as possible.

trans-unit.source: When the two classes can't be clearly separated, the algorithms find the best boundary they can.
trans-unit.target: When the two classes can't be clearly separated, the algorithms find the best boundary they can.

trans-unit.source: As written in Azure Machine Learning, the [two-class SVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905835.aspx) does this with a straight line only.
trans-unit.target: As written in Azure Machine Learning, the [two-class SVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905835.aspx) does this with a straight line only.

trans-unit.source: (In SVM-speak, it uses a linear kernel.) Because it makes this linear approximation, it is able to run fairly quickly.
trans-unit.target: (In SVM-speak, it uses a linear kernel.) Because it makes this linear approximation, it is able to run fairly quickly.

trans-unit.source: Where it really shines is with feature-intense data, like text or genomic.
trans-unit.target: Where it really shines is with feature-intense data, like text or genomic.

trans-unit.source: In these cases SVMs are able to separate classes more quickly and with less overfitting than most other algorithms, in addition to requiring only a modest amount of memory.
trans-unit.target: In these cases SVMs are able to separate classes more quickly and with less overfitting than most other algorithms, in addition to requiring only a modest amount of memory.

trans-unit.source: ![Support vector machine class boundary][7]
trans-unit.target: ![Support vector machine class boundary][7]

trans-unit.source: ***A typical support vector machine class boundary maximizes the margin separating two classes***
trans-unit.target: ***A typical support vector machine class boundary maximizes the margin separating two classes***

trans-unit.source: Another product of Microsoft Research, the [two-class locally deep SVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913070.aspx) is a non-linear variant of SVM that retains most of the speed and memory efficiency of the linear version.
trans-unit.target: Another product of Microsoft Research, the [two-class locally deep SVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913070.aspx) is a non-linear variant of SVM that retains most of the speed and memory efficiency of the linear version.

trans-unit.source: It is ideal for cases where the linear approach doesn't give accurate enough answers.
trans-unit.target: It is ideal for cases where the linear approach doesn't give accurate enough answers.

trans-unit.source: The developers kept it fast by breaking the problem down into a bunch of small linear SVM problems.
trans-unit.target: The developers kept it fast by breaking the problem down into a bunch of small linear SVM problems.

trans-unit.source: Read the [full description](http://research.microsoft.com/um/people/manik/pubs/Jose13.pdf) for the details on how they pulled off this trick.
trans-unit.target: Read the [full description](http://research.microsoft.com/um/people/manik/pubs/Jose13.pdf) for the details on how they pulled off this trick.

trans-unit.source: Using a clever extension of nonlinear SVMs, the [one-class SVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913103.aspx) draws a boundary that tightly outlines the entire data set.
trans-unit.target: Using a clever extension of nonlinear SVMs, the [one-class SVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913103.aspx) draws a boundary that tightly outlines the entire data set.

trans-unit.source: It is useful for anomaly detection.
trans-unit.target: It is useful for anomaly detection.

trans-unit.source: Any new data points that fall far outside that boundary are unusual enough to be noteworthy.
trans-unit.target: Any new data points that fall far outside that boundary are unusual enough to be noteworthy.

trans-unit.source: Bayesian methods
trans-unit.target: Bayesian methods

trans-unit.source: Bayesian methods have a highly desirable quality: they avoid overfitting.
trans-unit.target: Bayesian methods have a highly desirable quality: they avoid overfitting.

trans-unit.source: They do this by making some assumptions beforehand about the likely distribution of the answer.
trans-unit.target: They do this by making some assumptions beforehand about the likely distribution of the answer.

trans-unit.source: Another byproduct of this approach is that they have very few parameters.
trans-unit.target: Another byproduct of this approach is that they have very few parameters.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning has both Bayesian algorithms for both classification ([Two-class Bayes' point machine](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905930.aspx)) and regression ([Bayesian linear regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906022.aspx)).
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning has both Bayesian algorithms for both classification ([Two-class Bayes' point machine](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905930.aspx)) and regression ([Bayesian linear regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906022.aspx)).

trans-unit.source: Note that these assume that the data can be split or fit with a straight line.
trans-unit.target: Note that these assume that the data can be split or fit with a straight line.

trans-unit.source: On an historical note, Bayes' point machines were developed at Microsoft Research.
trans-unit.target: On an historical note, Bayes' point machines were developed at Microsoft Research.

trans-unit.source: They have some exceptionally beautiful theoretical work behind them.
trans-unit.target: They have some exceptionally beautiful theoretical work behind them.

trans-unit.source: The interested student is directed to the [original article in JMLR](http://jmlr.org/papers/volume1/herbrich01a/herbrich01a.pdf) and an [insightful blog by Chris Bishop](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/10/30/embracing-uncertainty-probabilistic-inference.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The interested student is directed to the [original article in JMLR](http://jmlr.org/papers/volume1/herbrich01a/herbrich01a.pdf) and an [insightful blog by Chris Bishop](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/10/30/embracing-uncertainty-probabilistic-inference.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Specialized algorithms
trans-unit.target: Specialized algorithms

trans-unit.source: If you have a very specific goal you may be in luck.
trans-unit.target: If you have a very specific goal you may be in luck.

trans-unit.source: Within the Azure Machine Learning collection there are algorithms that specialize in rank prediction ([ordinal regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906029.aspx)), count prediction ([Poisson regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905988.aspx)), and anomaly detection (one based on [principal components analysis](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913102.aspx) and one based on [support vector machine](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913103.aspx)s).
trans-unit.target: Within the Azure Machine Learning collection there are algorithms that specialize in rank prediction ([ordinal regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn906029.aspx)), count prediction ([Poisson regression](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905988.aspx)), and anomaly detection (one based on [principal components analysis](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913102.aspx) and one based on [support vector machine](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn913103.aspx)s).

trans-unit.source: And there is a lone clustering algorithm as well ([K-means](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/5049a09b-bd90-4c4e-9b46-7c87e3a36810/)).
trans-unit.target: And there is a lone clustering algorithm as well ([K-means](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/5049a09b-bd90-4c4e-9b46-7c87e3a36810/)).

trans-unit.source: ![PCA-based anomaly detection][8]
trans-unit.target: ![PCA-based anomaly detection][8]

trans-unit.source: ***PCA-based anomaly detection*** *- the vast majority of the data falls into a stereotypical distribution; points deviating dramatically from that distribution are suspect*
trans-unit.target: ***PCA-based anomaly detection*** *- the vast majority of the data falls into a stereotypical distribution; points deviating dramatically from that distribution are suspect*

trans-unit.source: ![Data set grouped using K-means][9]
trans-unit.target: ![Data set grouped using K-means][9]

trans-unit.source: ***A data set is grouped into 5 clusters using K-means***
trans-unit.target: ***A data set is grouped into 5 clusters using K-means***

trans-unit.source: There is also an ensemble [one-v-all multiclass classifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905887.aspx), which breaks the N-class classification problem into N-1 two-class classification problems.
trans-unit.target: There is also an ensemble [one-v-all multiclass classifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905887.aspx), which breaks the N-class classification problem into N-1 two-class classification problems.

trans-unit.source: The accuracy, training time, and linearity properties are determined by the two-class classifiers used.
trans-unit.target: The accuracy, training time, and linearity properties are determined by the two-class classifiers used.

trans-unit.source: ![Two-class classifiers combined to form a three-class classifier][10]
trans-unit.target: ![Two-class classifiers combined to form a three-class classifier][10]

trans-unit.source: ***A pair of two-class classifiers combine to form a three-class classifier***
trans-unit.target: ***A pair of two-class classifiers combine to form a three-class classifier***

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning also includes access to a powerful machine learning framework under the title of [Vowpal Wabbit](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/8383eb49-c0a3-45db-95c8-eb56a1fef5bf).
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning also includes access to a powerful machine learning framework under the title of [Vowpal Wabbit](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/8383eb49-c0a3-45db-95c8-eb56a1fef5bf).

trans-unit.source: VW defies categorization here, since it can learn both classification and regression problems and can even learn from partially unlabeled data.
trans-unit.target: VW defies categorization here, since it can learn both classification and regression problems and can even learn from partially unlabeled data.

trans-unit.source: You can configure it to use any one of a number of learning algorithms, loss functions, and optimization algorithms.
trans-unit.target: You can configure it to use any one of a number of learning algorithms, loss functions, and optimization algorithms.

trans-unit.source: It was designed from the ground up to be efficient, parallel, and extremely fast.
trans-unit.target: It was designed from the ground up to be efficient, parallel, and extremely fast.

trans-unit.source: It handles ridiculously large feature sets with little apparent effort.
trans-unit.target: It handles ridiculously large feature sets with little apparent effort.

trans-unit.source: Started and led by Microsoft Research's own John Langford, VW is a Formula One entry in a field of stock car algorithms.
trans-unit.target: Started and led by Microsoft Research's own John Langford, VW is a Formula One entry in a field of stock car algorithms.

trans-unit.source: Not every problem fits VW, but if yours does, it may be worth your while to climb the learning curve on its interface.
trans-unit.target: Not every problem fits VW, but if yours does, it may be worth your while to climb the learning curve on its interface.

trans-unit.source: It's also available as [stand-alone open source code](https://github.com/JohnLangford/vowpal_wabbit) in several languages.
trans-unit.target: It's also available as [stand-alone open source code](https://github.com/JohnLangford/vowpal_wabbit) in several languages.
